item.title: Alumni Dinner
item.description: Meet some recent and not-so-recent tEp alumni over dinner. We provide the food, they provide stories and advice. (Ask about what happens when you attach handcuffs to a fire sprinkler.)

item.title: Hemiformal Party
item.description: Our first party of the semester. Dress code: hemiformal! Rent a tuxedo and split it with your friend.

item.title: Movie Night
item.description: Enjoy your last day of freedom before the problem sets return.

item.title: Eat What We Found in the Wok
Godel, Escher, Wok
item.description: An entirely new theory of House Food cooking.

item.title: Iron tEps Eating Competition
item.description: Which cook wins the grand prize? You be the judge.

item.title: Iron tEps Cooking Competition
item.description: What’s for dinner? We don’t know either. Come join tEp’s culinary experts in the ultimate cooking challenge.

item.title: Cocoa
item.description: Our weekly hot cocoa study break, with bread, cheese, and other tasty snacks.

item.title: Dramatic Dr. Seuss
item.description: A childhood classic, with a new twist.

item.title: Haus Fud
item.description: Come enjoy a home-cooked meal after the first day of classes. Ask us about the food fight rules.

item.title: Cook Haus Fud
item.description: Join Team Tuesday in their battle against pork groin, leafy vegetables, and that mysterious smell in the left refrigerator. Cooking experience not required.

item.title: Duck, Duck, Chili
item.description: Come on over for a Thai dinner. If it gets too spicy for you, we have indoor water and running toilets.

item.title: Powerpoint Roulette
item.description: Deliver a PowerPoint presentation without any idea what’s coming on the next slide! Good practice for real life. Once your presentation is over, help us craft the next slide deck.

item.title: Food Orgy
item.description: Our biggest feast yet. The only rule: you can’t feed yourself. Grab a friend and head over to tEp!

item.title: Inappropriate Drilling
item.description: What happens when you twirl al dente spaghetti at 3000 rpm? It’s like Deepwater Horizon all over again.
